meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a penumbra.
meanings.sent1: The penumbral light softly illuminated the room, creating a gentle glow.
meanings.sent2: The artist used penumbral colors to give the painting a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The penumbral shadows danced playfully on the wall, making the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her penumbral presence at the party added an air of mystery to the event.
meanings.sent5: The penumbral mist enveloped the forest, making it feel enchanted.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the partially shaded outer region of a shadow.
meanings.sent1: The penumbral area around the tree was where the sunlight and shadow met.
meanings.sent2: The penumbral edge of the cloud cast a faint shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed lounging in the penumbral corner of the room, away from direct sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts lingered in the penumbral space between reality and dreams.
meanings.sent5: The penumbral outline of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.
